did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Charles D. Wrege Research Materials Memorabilia,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Charles "Chuck" Wrege finished his undergraduate degree in Upsala College, obtained his Masters degree at the New School fo Social Research and another Masters of Business Administration and his Ph.D. at NYU. He taught industrial management at Rutgers University for 30 years. He became a renowned historian, researcher and writer. He is regarded as a "National Treasure" by many in his field because of his expertise and the seminal research he has done in the area of management history.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Charles D. Wrege Research Materials Memorabilia #6395 MB. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: unassembled pieces of an E-901 relay are attached to a board and was used to demonstrate how to put one together
